channel.title: Java memory help ( mac )
channel.description: is there a way on mac to give java more memory? because i cant find out how =(! any1 know?

item.title: Java memory help ( mac )
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:8, topic:349197”]Idk if this is what your aiming for, but you can set the maximum allowed heap size for a specific program using

-Xmx*m

* - Allowed heap size in Mb.

If you were trying to say you wanted java.exe and javac.exe to have more memory so they would work faster, Idk.[/quote]This or get better hardware. That’s all you got.

Read full topic

item.title: Java memory help ( mac )
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“cahhillbuddy, post:7, topic:349197”]sorry my brother was typing, im trying to move some of my memory/hardrive space into my jdk/java files so that java has more memory to use. that should clear it up… =)[/quote] I do hope you know that your HDD is only storage, and its your RAM that is the memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Java memory help ( mac )
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Well that goes in the batch code that starts the program, for example

@echo off
title Runserver
java -Xmx1024m Server

I’m not sure that it will help the effectiveness of the program though.

Read full topic

item.title: Java memory help ( mac )
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Idk if this is what your aiming for, but you can set the maximum allowed heap size for a specific program using

-Xmx[b]*[/b]m

* - Allowed heap size in Mb.

If you were trying to say you wanted java.exe and javac.exe to have more memory so they would work faster, Idk.

Read full topic
